private_information: I have detailed familiarity with actions: paltry, sip, clip.
I have partial views of preconditions and effects for these actions involving predicates hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze.
planner_A.goal: Contribute a clear, consistent symbolic encoding of paltry, sip, and clip that can be integrated into a complete planning model to achieve the global next relations.

private_information: I have detailed familiarity with actions: wretched, memory, tightfisted.
I have partial views of preconditions and effects for these actions involving predicates sneeze, texture, stupendous, collect, spring, next, vase.
planner_B.goal: Contribute a clear, consistent symbolic encoding of wretched, memory, and tightfisted that can be integrated into a complete planning model to achieve the global next relations.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post-hoc penalties.
I verify that preconditions and effects are causally coherent and that no transient bookkeeping predicates are used to hide real dependencies.
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report enumerating inconsistencies, hidden bookkeeping shortcuts, and corrected causal constraints so planners can emit a clean, solver-ready model.

private_information: I will integrate partial models and the audit into a final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Assemble the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem that realize the global goal and are compatible with FastDownwards.

public_information: Available actions and their informal descriptions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Predicates used across the domain include: hand OBJ, cats OBJ, texture OBJ, vase OBJ OBJ, next OBJ OBJ, sneeze OBJ, stupendous OBJ, collect OBJ OBJ, spring OBJ.
paltry requires: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2. paltry adds next object_0 object_2 and removes vase object_0 object_1.
sip requires: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2. sip adds vase object_0 object_1 and removes next object_0 object_2.
clip requires: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2. clip adds vase object_0 object_1 and removes next object_0 object_2.

wretched requires: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3. wretched adds next object_0 object_2 and removes next object_0 object_1.
memory requires: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1. memory adds next object_0 object_2 and removes next object_0 object_1.
tightfisted requires: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1. tightfisted adds next object_0 object_2 and removes vase object_0 object_1.

Initial facts in the scenario: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_10 object_5, next object_11 object_5, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_7, next object_9 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.
Global goal: next object_10 object_8 and next object_11 object_7 and next object_9 object_6.

analyze_actions.system_prompt: You are planner_A. Your role is analytical rather than generative of the final solver model. Produce clear, machine-consumable structured summaries of the actions paltry, sip, and clip. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on consistent predicate naming, parameter lists, typed argument roles if useful, and explicit precondition and effect lists. If information is missing, flag the gaps instead of guessing.
analyze_actions.prompt: Given the environment public information and your private knowledge, produce a structured description of paltry, sip, and clip as JSON-like action schemas including parameters, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects, and enumerate any implicit assumptions you made or gaps that need resolution.

analyze_actions.system_prompt: You are planner_B. Your role is analytical and complementary to planner_A. Produce structured summaries for the actions wretched, memory, and tightfisted. Do not emit PDDL. Provide parameter lists, explicit preconditions, add effects, delete effects, and identify any potential naming mismatches or ambiguous object roles.
analyze_actions.prompt: Given the environment public information and your private knowledge, produce a structured description of wretched, memory, and tightfisted as JSON-like action schemas including parameters, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects, and enumerate any implicit assumptions or ambiguities that must be reconciled.

audit.system_prompt: You are the auditor. Your responsibility is to check temporal and causal consistency, to detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts, and to produce corrected constraints and annotations that eliminate ad-hoc tokens or post-hoc tricks. Provide an explicit list of recommended changes and a reconciled, causally coherent predicate set. Do not produce final PDDL, only an audit report suitable to guide the orchestrator.
audit.prompt: Given the two analysis artifacts from planner_A and planner_B and the public information, check for causal cycles, missing causal links, and any bookkeeping shortcuts such as transient quota tokens or synthetic predicates used only to enforce order. Provide a reconciled predicate vocabulary, point out contradictions, propose corrections, and emit a corrected set of action schemas or annotations that resolve ambivalence.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and integrator. Your job is to take the structured action summaries from planners and the auditor report, resolve remaining ambiguities, and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem tuned for the FastDownwards solver. Emit a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem and ensure actions remain distinct per agent origin where appropriate. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the resulting model is compatible with STRIPS-style FastDownwards usage and declare any typing or requirements explicitly.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the two planner analyses and the auditor report together with the public information and initial facts, resolve naming differences, and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that implement the global goal next object_10 object_8 and next object_11 object_7 and next object_9 object_6. Keep agent-origin actions distinct if that clarifies concurrency or resource ownership. Output the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards solver and include any required :requirements and :types declarations.
